answers.answer: Hi,It is possible that you have prostatitis causing you to have urgency and pain, burning during urination. Prostatitis is poorly understood and can be difficult to control.Try to increase your intake of water, about 8 glasses a day. It should clear up your urine.I started having tis at about the age of 18 and still have it at the age of 45 now.I hope that you can get this under control.All the best.Ron

It is also possible that you have Interstitial Cystitis or IC as itis commonally called.This disease affects mostly women,but  does occur with some men.I myself have IC andyour symtoms are very close to mine.However,I recommend going to a urologist to get a professionaldiagnoses. Mention the IC .Some Urologists overlook this diagnoses.Good luck to you.LynnAnn
I have seen a urologist 2 times and they think i have urinary retention. I have been on hytrin (sp?) for 2 months now and i have seen no results.
My diet consists of only water. Nothing else and it is enough and still haven't seen anything different.

question: I'm 16. Male. This has been going on for a year now. Here are my symptoms; Frequent urination, Urgency, Pain during and after urination, Irritation along the urinary tract. I have been tested for STD's and a uti and both came out negative. I do not have diabetes either. I have only been drinking water for 8 months now and my urine is still dark yellow and burns. I do not wake up during the night to go to the bathroom. I do not consume too much water. What could this be? i'm begging you
title: I am experiencing terrible urinary problems
